intro: Stranvaesia glaucescens var. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan stranvaesia, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky and forested habitats, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
